sen.j: フトダマは、日本神話に登場する神。
sen.e: Futodama is a god that appears in Japanese mythology.

sen.j: 古事記では布刀玉命、日本書紀では太玉命、古語拾遺では天太玉命（あめのふとだまのみこと）と表記する。
sen.e: His name is written as Futodama no mikoto in the Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters), Futodama no mikoto in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), and Ameno Futodama no mikoto in Kogoshui (History of the Inbe Clan).

His name is written as 布刀玉命 (Futodama no Mikoto) in the Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters), 太玉命 (Futodama no Mikoto) in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), and 天太玉命 (Ameno Futodama no Mikoto) in Kogoshui (History of the Inbe Clan).

sen.j: 天岩戸の際、天照大神を岩戸から出すためにオモイカネが策を考えた。
sen.e: At the occasion of Ama no iwato (Cave of heaven) Omoikane came up with a plan to get Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) out of the cave.

sen.j: その策が良いかどうかを占うため、天児屋命とともに太占（ふとまに）を行った。
sen.e: He conducted futomani with Amenokoyane no mikoto in order to read whether the plan was good or not.

sen.j: そして、勾玉や八咫鏡などを下げた天の香山の五百箇真賢木（いおつまさかき）を捧げ持ち、アマテラスが岩戸から顔をのぞかせると、アメノコヤネとともにその前に鏡を差し出した。
sen.e: Then, when Amaterasu peeked out of the cave he brought Iotsumasakaki of Ama no Kaguyama adorned with magadama (comma-shaped jewel) and Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror; one of the Imperial regalia), and he and Amenokoyane presented the mirror before her.

sen.cmt: 五百箇真賢木 榊の木 のようですので、ever green tree と補足しました（定訳不明です）。

sen.j: 天孫降臨の際には、ニニギに従って天降るよう命じられ、五伴緒の一人として随伴した。
sen.e: Upon Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess) he was ordered to descend with Ninigi, and he accompanied him as one of itsutomonoo (chiefs of the five clans).

sen.e: In one section of Nihonshoki it is written that he, along with Amenokoyane, was ordered to become a protector of the shrine that enshrines Amaterasu (Ise-jingu Shrine).
